content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.12 - Executive order no. 12: establishing health advisory council

State Regulations

There is no higher priority for this administration than
providing our citizens with access to quality health care at a price they can
afford. To achieve this goal, it is evident that new and innovative policies
must be developed in the areas of health care organization, delivery and
financing. We must draw upon the very best minds and talents available, both
inside and outside of government, and the expertise of many disciplines to
solve our immediate problems and develop workable long-range health policies on
which to build for the future. Therefore, I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of New

York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and the Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby establish an interdisciplinary health
advisory council, to be known as the Health Advisory Council, to act as an
advisory council to the Health Planning Commission, as established by Executive

Order Number 6, effective March 14, 1975. The Health Advisory Council shall
consist of non-governmental representatives from a wide-range of disciplines, professions and backgrounds related to the health field. I. Powers and Responsibilities

The Health Advisory Council shall: 1. Advise the Governor, through the Health

Planning Commission, on health policy matters; 2. Serve as an information gathering and
advisory body for the Governor and the Health Planning Commission; 3. Undertake in-depth, interdisciplinary
studies related to the organization, delivery and financing of health care
services; 4. Develop
recommendations for alternative legislative and administrative initiatives to
improve the State's health care system; 5. Identify developing and potential problems
and issues related to health and health care; 6. Review proposed health legislation to
determine its feasibility, impact and consistency with long-range health
goals; 7. Concern itself with
health issues which involve several departments or agencies of
government; 8. Perform such other
functions and duties as may be requested by the Governor and/or the Chairman of
the Health Planning Commission. II. Structure and Organization

Members of the Health Advisory Council shall be appointed
by the Governor and serve at his pleasure. The Governor shall appoint
co-chairmen, who shall be empowered to organize the membership into
organizational study units deemed necessary to effectively exercise the
responsibilities of the Council. Members of the Council will receive no compensation for
their services as members, but shall be allowed their actual and necessary
expenses incurred in the performance of their duties within the amount
available therefor. III. Health Planning Advisory Council

The Health Planning Advisory Council, as established by

Executive Order Number 6, is hereby continued to advise the Health Planning

Commission in the exercise of its powers, functions and duties relating to the

National Health Planning Resources Act of 1974 and any other act relating to
comprehensive health planning. Signed: Hugh L. CareyDated: May 28, 1975
